availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Married to Virginia Harrison. Father of Annie Harrison, Edward Harrison, Clara Harrison, and Charles Harrison. Attorney in partnership with Moses Bennett in Louisville. Confirmed as a notary public in Jefferson County on February 5, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, 2nd District, p. 117.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Edwards Pond Precinct p. 36.
U.S. City Directories, 1822-1995, Louisville, 1865.
Find A Grave, "James Harrison (1799-1890)," Memorial #96287332, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/96287332/harr (accessed July, 24, 2017).
KYR-0001-017-0062.
